item.title: HoYoverse: Best Games By miHoYo, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • miHoYo's games revolve around cute female characters, with each game offering unique gameplay experiences.
  • FlyMe2theMoon showcases Kiana Kaslana as the poster child of miHoYo, featuring skill-based gameplay and charming art.
  • Honkai: Star Rail is considered MiHoYo's best game, offering an engaging space odyssey story with Gacha elements.

HoYoverse , mainly known as MiHoYo , have been developing games for otakus for more than a decade. In their journey of 10+ years they have released a variety of games. While the core theme of the games remains the same, revolving around cute female characters as the playable avatars, each game is vastly different from each other in many ways.

MiHoYo has more than half a dozen games under their belt, and while most of these games do not belong in the same genre, a question arises nonetheless: Which game is the best? This list answers that question by ranking all the games by MiHoYo from worst to best.

9 Legend Of Saha

The Beginning Of The Journey

Platforms

Web Browser

Released

2010

Genre(s)

Flash Game, Platform

Developer(s)

Cai Haoyu

Having Legend of Saha on this list at all is a stretch, but the game deserves a spot as an honorable mention, as it kicks off a thrilling adventure for the founders of MiHoYo , the tech otakus who save the world.

The game was originally supposed to be a part of a bigger game, but a flash game was made with only one character by Cai Haoyu in 2010 for a student competition. The game won some prizes in the competition, which acted as a stepping stone for the eventual founding of MiHoYo.

Despite being a simple game where players are tasked with moving from one level to another dodging enemy attacks, it's rich with story, presented in the form of walls of text. Legend of Saha lays the foundation for the games eventually created by MiHoYo, and there is a chance that the story of Misei Nanatsuki, the main character of Legend of Saha , could be reused in Genshin Impact .

8 FlyMe2theMoon

Introducing The Poster Child Of MiHoYo

Platform(s)

iOS

Released

28 September 2011

Developer(s)

miHoYo

Publisher(s)

miHoYo

Genre(s)

Side-Scroller

FlyMe2theMoon is the game where the character Kiana Kaslana was brought to life , who further served as the poster child for MiHoYo. This game revolves around controlling Kiana, equipped with a jetpack, as she has to navigate through obstacles to try and reach the moon. The game featured plenty of levels to play and came with a soundtrack made with VOCALOID software named MoonTrip.

The name of the game was inspired from the ending theme of Neon Genesis Evangelion , which also served as the basis for the game’s concept. This 2D side scrolling game features different modes, like adventure, puzzle, racing and exploration. It is moderately challenging, and it keeps players engaged over the course of 60 levels. With a nice art style and skill-based gameplay, even if the game is rough in the controls department, FlyMe2theMoon is a good game that can keep players entertained hours.

7 Zombiegal Kawaii / Houkai Gakuen

Even The Zombies Are Too Adorable To Shoot

Platform(s)

Android, iOS

Released

November 2012

Developer(s)

miHoYo

Publisher(s)

miHoYo

Genre(s)

Shooter

Moving on from FlyMe2theMoon , miHoYo takes a leap when they create Zombiegal Kawaii , also known as Houkai Gakuen . This side-scrolling shooter takes the players on a zombie killing spree inspired by the anime manga series Highschool of the Dead . The shoot-em-up style gameplay paired with adorable art and cute voice work keeps the atmosphere of the game light. Players control Kiana once again, as she fights against large hordes of deadly yet adorable zombies.

Related
What's Your Favorite Zombie Game?

Zombie games are a dime a dozen, but despite the saturated market, there are some titles that stand out like diamonds in the rough. Setting aside big titles like Left 4 Dead and Dying Light, my personal favorite zombie game is Project Zomboid. It's incredibly immersive despite the isometric perspective, and very few games manage to capture the bleak hopelessness of a zombie apocalypse quite like Zomboid does.

While at times upgrades become a necessity to make progress, and players can either use real money or grind for a few hours to steadily make progress, it doesn’t hinder the overall enjoyability of the game. The entire vibe of is fun and lighthearted, and with its simple gameplay, Zombiegal Kawaii attracted plenty of gaming otakus towards miHoYo.

6 Guns GirlZ / Houkai Gakuen 2

A Step Up From Its Predecessor

Platform(s)

Android, iOS

Released

9 August 2014

Developer(s)

miHoYo

Publisher(s)

miHoYo, Mihoyo Inc.

Genre(s)

Shooter

Soon after the first Houkai Gakuen was released, miHoyo worked hard and fast to release the second installment in the series. This is the first time the developers stuck with the same gameplay style as their previous game. Guns GirlZ takes over from its predecessor while telling a comprehensive story for the first time in any of miHoYo's games.

The narrative expands on the simple setting of its predecessor, as it depicts girls surviving the zombie apocalypse due to a Houkai phenomenon that occurs once in several centuries. GGZ makes gameplay more interesting by adding more characters and weapons, which can be further upgraded using in-game resources.

An additional multiplayer mode is also available for players to play with friends. GGZ also introduces a Guild system, where multiple players can join a guild to access more opportunities for events and rewards. With a proper story that expands with frequent game updates, along with many other additional features, Gun GirlsZ turned out to be a financial success, forcing miHoYo to increase their team size if they wanted to grow further.

5 Tears Of Themis

A Treat For Otome Fans

miHoYo has always explored different genres when developing a new title. Tears of Themis focused on a different side of otaku culture that was not yet explored by miHoyo. The game falls in the mystery romance genre, and almost plays itself via a visual novel format. With a self-insert character for players, the protagonist starts her journey as a rookie lawyer brimming with ambition and determined to help people.

The story involves players solving various cases and getting involved with the four main potential love interests. The game has a variety of stuff to do, ranging from completing cases and progressing the story to collecting characters from the Gacha system and completing time-limited events to collect rewards.

Tears of Themis takes ideas from other otome games and puts its own spin on them, thus creating something new while honoring the familiar elements of the genre. While the gameplay might not be everyone's cup of tea, Tears of Themis will be loved by otome fans and players looking for mysterious stories, compelling art, and bold romances.

4 Zenless Zone Zero

The Latest Entry From HoYoverse

Zenless Zone Zero is the latest HoYoverse endeavor in their grand journey of making games for the otakus. Pivoting from the fantasy setting of Genshin Impact and the space adventures of Honkai Star Rail , HoYoverse moves to make Zenless Zone Zero a game set in an urban dystopia.

This action RPG is by far Hoyoverse’s best work when it comes to fluid character animations and physics. Utilizing various characters in combat, parrying enemy attacks at the right time to trigger intro skills and performing various combos to defeat the enemies forms the core gameplay of ZZZ.

Zenless Zone Zero has more style and esthetic excellence than any HoYoverse game. Instead of featuring a vast open world with a grand story where the players are up against the gods, the game takes a more grounded approach, as players experience the story of two tech enthusiast siblings and their day-to-day adventures in a retro dystopia.

3 Honkai Impact 3

The Game That Established miHoYo

miHoYo have dabbled with a variety of projects since their formation, but it was with Honkai Impact 3rd when they found immense success. HI3 represents the evolution of miHoYo from a niche Gacha game development company to one of the biggest powerhouses in the Gacha market.

Taking a big gamble when developing the game, miHoYo’s plan for their next game was a 3D action RPG Gacha, and with constant support for the game, they have righteously taken HI3 to another level. There are a ton of reasons to explain the popularity of the game back when it was released in 2016. From smooth animations and fluid gameplay to the adorable playable characters, Honkai Impact 3rd is a treat for the otakus.

However, as that strong gameplay evolved with time, miHoYo also successfully created a compelling story with unique characters to keep players invested and, while the game is witnessing an end to its 7-year-long saga, it is still going strong with new content, characters, and gameplay to attract fans even after almost a decade.

2 Genshin Impact

Making Gacha Games More Mainstream

Genshin Impact made waves in the gaming space when it was launched in 2020. The open world RPG appealed to a vast audience, and acted as a gateway for players who were strangers to Gacha games . miHoYo has always been focusing on new things and, with Genshin Impact , their newfound focus was on creating a breathtaking open world full of diversity came to life when they created the beautiful world of Teyvat.

The boundless world of Teyvat is divided into 7 unique nations, and each part of Teyvat offers a plethora of activities for players to take on. From exploring the beautiful world of the game to fighting monsters and bosses, collecting loot and new characters, and then upgrading them for use in combat, there is no end in sight in terms of content offered. The combat in the game is also unique, as it creates its own elemental reaction system, and players have to use a mixture of various elements in battle efficiently and string together some serious combos.

By creating a game that appeals to casual players who like to explore the world and immerse themselves in the lore of a game, and to the hardcore ones who like to build teams and characters to fight enemies as effectively as possible, this Breath of the Wild- inspired game is something special, making it one of the best HoYoverse games ever made.

1 Honkai: Star Rail

Going On A Majestic Interstellar Journey

After spending many years creating action RPGs, miHoYo moved on to try something different, and began the creation of Honkai: Star Rail . This turn-based RPG is by far miHoYo’s best game, as it learns from the mistakes of the previous games and creates something engaging and entertaining.

miHoYo always had a reputation for creating intricate stories, and Honkai: Star Rail lives up to their reputation. Playing as an amnesiac protagonist, the players embark on a space odyssey, visiting different planets, meeting new characters, and unraveling the mystery behind their origins.

The gameplay takes the Gacha elements of the game into consideration, and creates a style that is suited to both possible scenarios: Manual battles where players have to carefully strategize, and an auto-battle option to grind stages quickly and effectively to level characters up.

Apart from this, the game features a big area to explore while playing the story, filled with surprises to discover. The worlds in Star Rail are lively, and players can interact with everything, even random objects, which is an amusing little detail. Fun interactions, quirky dialogue, and pop culture references are commonly found in Star Rail , and they balance well with the darker themes of the game, like loss, injustice, and suffering.

Paying attention to little details and learning from past mistakes, HoYoverse has created its best RPG yet . Star Rail offers dozens of hours of gameplay to keep players engaged, and with more content to come, that will only increase. It also features extremely player-friendly support for a Gacha game, which makes Honkai: Star Rail by far the best game created by miHoYo.

item.title: 7 Best Horror Games Inspired By Sonic (According To Itch.io)
item.description:
Sonic The Hedgehog is a beloved figure, lending his name to an abundance of games in the Sonic franchise, including crossover games such as Super Smash Bros. and Mario and Sonic . As such, it is no surprise that he has found his way into the realm of horror. Since the creepypasta "SONIC.EXE" was posted in 2011 by JC-the-Hyena — revolving around a cursed Sonic game in which Sonic is some kind of evil entity — Sonic horror games have steadily increased in popularity.

Despite still being a relatively niche corner of the gaming world, many platforms are saturated with Sonic and Sonic.exe fan-games, and it can be difficult to distinguish which ones are trustworthy or even worth playing. The following are among the highest rated Sonic horror games that can be found on itch.io .

7 Sonic Shock

Itch.io Score: 3

  • Developer: Haunted Bees Productions

Sonic Shock is a role-playing horror-adventure game. Waking at "Space Colony M0B1" after being cryogenically frozen, the player must find mayhem rubies to find and defeat "Doctor Roboton," who has turned everyone into robots.

Quite unlike the games in the Sonic franchise, this one takes certain elements and remodels them into something entirely new. Considering it is made entirely from stock photos, Sonic Shock has a surprisingly retro feel and its own unique atmosphere. With shooter and stealth mechanics, and the option to upgrade abilities, this game is great for all kinds of gamers — not just horror fans.

6 Felix And Friends

Itch.io Score: 4

  • Developer: Wrath of Wood

In Felix and Friends , the player takes on the role of Felix the Cat, another familiar character from the cartoon world. After his home is broken into by "The Copywriters," who have sent other famous figures after him for breaking copyright law, he flees. While not overtly gory or jump-scary, the familiar yet different character and environment designs are extremely uncanny.

Traversing different levels of a Sonic -inspired platform world, players will come across a range of bosses, each modeled after familiar game and TV characters. After defeating these bosses ("Soniku" being the first they come across), the player can play as them. Overall, Felix and Friends is both comical and very self-aware, offering a well put-together experience that comments on the fan-game industry.

5 Sonic's School Day

Itch.io Score: 4

  • Developer: MrScottyPieey

Sonic's School Day is a first-person survival horror game. Harking back to the original SEGA educational game, Sonic's Schoolhouse , the player must navigate a maze of classrooms and hallways and escape a variety of different characters.

With surreal environments, multiplayer mode, and math and spelling elements, this game is extremely unsettling. Players will never know what to expect when they turn a corner. Sonic's School Day also supports mods for gamers who enjoy customizing their games.

4 Sonic 1 Prototype

Itch.io Score: 4

  • Developer: MosaicArts

Sonic 1 Prototype begins relatively normally in the Green Hill Zone of the original Sonic the Hedgehog (1991). With familiar loops and ring collection, this game could be mistaken for any other Sonic game. However, there are some hints that all is not as it seems.

As the player progresses through the acts, they may notice dead animals scattered about the landscape. During Act 3, the sky turns black, and the landscape becomes obscured by a static hue. Once the error pops up and the player is told to "Leave Now," they can heed the warning or continue — at their own risk.

3 Executable Education

Itch.io Score: 4.2

  • Developer: Shroudy Software

Executable Education is a first-person horror game with three different levels. First, the player must find functional computers in their office to type words and remove the sonic.exe virus, while being stalked by a disturbingly dark version of Sonic. Once completed, they clip to a school where they must complete math tasks as a ruler-wielding Sonic hunts them down. Finally, they must monitor and fend off hostile Sonic robots via security cameras.

Overall, Executable Education has diverse gameplay that draws on other familiar mechanics and environments while maintaining its own unique and horrific universe.

2 Five Nights At Sonic's Reimagined

Itch.io Score: 5

  • Developer: Sanic

As its title suggests, Five Nights at Sonic's Reimagined is a Sonic and Five Night's at Freddy's- inspired crossover. Taking on the night shift at SEGA Inc., the player must survive for five nights from 12am to 6am. It is not that simple, however, as the malfunctioning character performers that had been scrapped and locked away have now escaped.

Five Nights at Sonic's Reimagined maintains a lot of the tension that the best Five Nights at Freddy's games are known for, but at the same time, this game deviates to take on its own aesthetic and lore. With a bonus 6th night, unlockable extras, and a custom nights mode, Five Nights at Sonic's Reimagined is both entertaining and immersive.

1 Another Sonic.exe Fan Game (2.0)

Itch.io Score: 5

  • Developer: Pudim Abestado

An upgraded sequel to the developer's previous game of the same name, Another Sonic.exe Fan Game (2.0) is worth checking out. Each playable character (Tails, Knuckles, and Doctor Robotnik) has their own level, with different objectives tailored to their lore in the original game series.

Similarly, the characters have their own abilities that can help with the tasks; Tails can fly, Knuckles can punch, etc. They must complete the objectives in time or face the wrath of Sonic, who has his own evil agenda. This game is both challenging and fun, and it has a very dark atmosphere. It also has multiple endings, depending on the outcome of the different levels.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: 8 Things To Do After Completing The Dawntrail MSQ
item.description:
Final Fantasy 14 's newest expansion, Dawntrail , has arrived to quite a bit of fanfare and discussion from the game's fanbase, with a heavy focus being on the MSQ (main story quest), which stars the Warrior of Light, the Scions, and the main protagonist, Wuk Lamat.

Dawntrail's MSQ can often take players several days or even a couple of weeks to complete, as the game strives to provide a compelling story for its audience. After the completion of Dawntrail , there is a wide variety of features and activities for players to complete or indulge in, with FFXIV being an MMO that gives players the freedom to play the game however they desire.

8 Collect Aether Currents

Collecting Aether Currents Across All Of Dawntrail's Zones Will Make Traveling Easier

Throughout the MSQ, players must travel through scenic zones without being able to fly using their mounts. This is due to not having enough aether currents for each zone, which are found using the aether compass that leads players to the available aether.

After the MSQ, players can enter each zone to complete aether current side quests while collecting aether to be found in each location. Once all aether currents are collected, players can traverse through zones in only moments, allowing for events such as hunt trains to be more accessible.

7 Expert Dungeons

Post MSQ Dungeons That Offer More Of A Challenge

In Dawntrail's MSQ, players must complete six dungeons to progress through the story. As with every expansion, more dungeons are released later on to continually add content to FFXIV , with Dawntrail set to follow suit. After finishing the MSQ, players can immediately try out two expert dungeons in Tender Valley and The Strayborough Deadwalk, with players being able to pick up the dungeons from the NPC, Zeycihan, in Tuliyollal.

The second expert dungeon, The Strayborough Deadwalk, offers more of a challenge than regular dungeons, with players seeking harder content sure to find this dungeon appetizing.

6 Attain Tome Gear

Try To Get BIS Gear In Time For Raids

In every expansion, tome gear has been essential for going into savage raids, often giving a high enough item level to take on fights. Final Fantasy 14 offers players a variety of ways to collect Tomestones Of Aesthetics, with dungeons, roulettes, and hunt trains being the most popular methods for gaining tomes, which can be traded in for raid gear.

Even when tome gear can be upgraded upon when gaining gear from raids, much of the tome gear can be used for glamour, with many of the armor sets having quality designs that fit in with the expansion's themes.

5 Extreme Trials

Face Off Against Amped Up Versions Of Valigarmanda And Zoraal Ja

FFXIV has a selection of trials that provide fun and challenging mechanics, with much carrying over into their extreme versions. After completing the MSQ, which features fights such as Worqor Zormor and Everkeep, players can head in with their own party or go into a party finder to try and complete the trials as an extreme.

While completing the extreme trials may be challenging, the rewards compensate for the hardships, as players can attain mounts or raid gear that can give a high enough item level to start savage raids on day one.

4 Normal And Savage Raids

Take On The Arcadion In Its Normal Or Savage Form

One of the most significant parts of MMOs is the raid tiers — often released with every new expansion — with Dawntrail's new tier, The Arcadion, being highly anticipated. In these eight-person raids, players have four fights available in every tier, with a normal and savage version being available to attempt.

For more casual players, trying the normal version is a fun and enjoyable experience, as players can try out new fights with intriguing mechanics. For veterans and raid specialists, clearing the savage tier in statics is an impressive accomplishment many see as the crown jewel of Final Fantasy 14 and MMOs in general, providing both fun and a challenge for players who attempt the tier.

3 Design Dawntrail Glamour Sets Using New Dye System

Come Up With Costumes That Match Up With The Themes Of Dawntrail And Tural

FFXIV's glamour system has become one of the game's most essential features, with the new dye system in Dawntrail enabling even more creativity for players to engage with. Players who use the dye feature can now use two differing colors to design a clothing item, providing more options to create unique and striking costumes.

In addition, Dawntrail's dungeons offer several interesting armor sets that can be utilized with the new dye system to create mesmerizing glamour. The new level 97 dungeon, Vanguard, features armor sets that are a highlight of Dawntrail , with the gear being perfect for trying out the dye system.

2 Level Additional Jobs

Level Alternative Jobs To The New Max Level Of 100

With the multitude of jobs in FFXIV , many players alternate between jobs during each expansion, as the game offers roles that each have their own unique design and abilities. As Dawntrail raises the maximum level to 100, players can level each of their alternative jobs to engage in the latest raids if they wish to participate.

Besides being the max level for raid purposes, if a player is able to level all 21 jobs to level 100, The Outrunner mount is given to players to honor their achievement in Dawntrail .

1 Try Out Pictomancer And Viper Jobs

Play Dawntrail's New And Exciting Jobs

In Dawntrail , the expansion offers two new and exciting jobs in the Pictomancer and Viper, bringing an additional caster and melee DPS to FFXIV . Starting at level 80, Pictomancer and Viper are perfect to try out once the MSQ has been completed, giving players the time to experiment with the job as they aim to reach max level.

With both their flashy actions and animations, the roles make for entertaining gameplay that is sure to become fan favorites for many who try out the new jobs.

item.title: Sealed And Obscured By Shadow Meaning In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Clear The Shadow In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • Should You Burn The Sealing Tree In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Most of the map in Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree will be accessible to players early into entering the Realm of Shadow. While there is an ideal path in what order bosses are fought, there is a good bit of freedom in what order players tackle most of the bosses in the DLC.

This isn't the case with the final section of the DLC, which houses the final boss. Players will be able to get close to this final dungeon after defeating the Divine Beast Dancing Lion , but will find the path forward Sealed and Obscured by Shadow; here's how to clear the shadow and progress forward.

Updated July 14th, 2024 by Joshua Leeds: Burning The Sealing Tree is a major moment in Shadow Of The Erdtree. Despite the base game and DLC being open world, burning the Sealing Tree acts as a point of no return, with players needing to complete certain content before missing out on it after this moment. This article has been updated to include all the missable content along with additional content for players to go back and complete before proceeding to the final dungeon.

How To Clear The Shadow In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree

While this location can be accessed early on, the shadow is blocking the players from entering the final dungeon of the DLC. To clear the shadow, players will need to find and burn the Sealing Tree, which will require them to beat two of the major bosses throughout the DLC. The main required bosses are Romina, Saint of the Bud, and Messmer the Impaler .

Messmer The Impaler can be found first and is located at the top of the Shadow Keep, which is reached by progressing through to the very top of the Specimen Storehouse . Romina, Saint of the Bud will require players to enter the Shadow Keep, but instead, exit the Specimen Storehouse to the exit bridge of the Shadow Keep heading west. Romina, Saint of the Bud is found by traversing the Scorpion River Catacombs and reaching the westernmost section of this region .

Defeating Romina will give players access to the location of the sealing tree, with Messmer's Kindling being used when interacting with the Sealing Tree to give the player the option to burn the tree or wait.

Should You Burn The Sealing Tree In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Burning the Sealing Tree will unlock the final dungeon of the game, but also acts as a point of no return for the NPC quest lines found throughout Shadow Of The Erdtree . Players can still travel and explore the region as much as they would like, defeating missed bosses and getting missed items, but the NPC quest lines will all be ended once the Sealing Tree is burned.

After the Sealing Tree is burned, players will be teleported to one of the entrances to the final dungeon. Players can also travel back to where they fought the Divine Beast Dancing Lion and climb to stairs to enter the previously blocked path , leading to another entrance to the final dungeon, with both starting points meeting up quickly. There will be a Site of Grace and the ability to fast travel immediately available for players who just want to see the new area before going back and preparing more. This is the final legacy dungeon of the DLC and will have some of the hardest enemies there are. There is only one boss, the final boss, and players should consider finding every Scadutree Fragment to maximize their blessing rank.

There are multiple quest lines for players to complete in Shadow Of The Erdtree that are listed below for players looking to complete any or all before burning the Sealing Tree.

  • Needle Knight Leda
  • Hornsent
  • Redmane Freyja & Sir Ansbach
  • Thiollier
  • Fire Knight Queelign
  • Igon
  • Dryleaf Dane
  • Dragon Communion Priestess
  • Count Ymir
  • Swordhand of Night, Jolan
  • St. Trina

Entering the final dungeon and even defeating the final boss won't lock players out of all of the hidden bosses found throughout the DLC. Even so, it is recommended players take on these challenges before the final boss as some can even provide useful effects against him, such as Miquella's Great Rune. Other major optional bosses players should beat before the final boss are:

  • Bayle The Dread
  • Midra, Lord Of The Frenzied Flame
  • Putrescent Knight
  • Metyr, Mother Of Fingers

item.title: 8 Best Nintendo GameCube Games That Never Came To America
item.description:
Nintendo's GameCube console may have been overshadowed and largely undervalued when it released in 2001. However, it had, and still has, a large fan base and many dedicated gamers. It had well over 600 titles, but many of these were not localized and released in other countries. There were many games that either never reached American shores or that had planned releases in North America but never happened.

From Japan-exclusive anime tie-in games to games set across Europe, these Nintendo GameCube games were — and some of which still are — enjoyed by players across the world except in America. Some of these titles did eventually reach the USA , but only on later consoles. Even if some of these games can be enjoyed today, at the time, American players did not get to experience a whole host of exciting and intriguing GameCube titles.

8 Radirgy GeneriC

A Fast And Addictive Arcade Shooter

  • Release Date : 2006-05-25
  • Developer : MileStone Inc.
  • Genre : Shoot 'Em Up

Initially released for the Sega NAOMI arcade platform, Radirgy GeneriC was ported to the GameCube, PS2, and Dreamcast in Japan. This scrolling shoot ‘em up title follows protagonist Shizuru Kamigusa, who is allergic to radio waves but undertakes a mission to save her father from terrorists. Shizuru can use multiple weapons — those being a shield, sword, or gun, giving her different abilities, but each coming with its own advantages and disadvantages.

Radirgy GeneriC has funky and upbeat music, as well as unique cel-shaded graphics. Though it's not a long game at all, it offers great replayability, with the GameCube version sporting an extra mode — the ‘Manpuku Mode' — wherein players can go for a high score.

7 Nintendo Puzzle Collection

Cozy Puzzle Games That Could Be Enjoyed In Multiplayer

  • Release Date : 2003-02-07
  • Developer : Nintendo
  • Genre : Puzzle

Nintendo Puzzle Collection offers a cozy and simple play experience, containing three puzzles: Dr. Mario , Yoshi’s Cookie and Panel de Pon . These three mini-games had previously been released on older consoles in America. This compilation was exclusively released in Japan and added a multiplayer mode to support four players at once, along with more polished graphics. All three games follow Tetris -style gameplay.

All three games are very similar and short, but they offer a lighthearted experience for anyone looking for a simple, fun game. It is also compatible with the Game Boy Advance via a link cable, meaning the games could be downloaded and enjoyed on a handheld console — a great feature perfect for playing on the go.

6 Largo Winch: Empire Under Threat

Has A Deep Story Taking Place All Over The World

  • Release Date : 2002-10-01
  • Developer : Dupuis
  • Genre : Action-Adventure

Published by Ubi Soft, Largo Winch: Empire Under Threat takes players on a globetrotting adventure following a James Bond-style plot. Released only in PAL regions, Largo must investigate the mysterious disappearance of a scientist after just becoming the heir to the billion-dollar company, Group W. The adventure becomes gradually more thrilling and intense as Winch travels all over the world to stop a conspiracy against Group W.

The game is puzzle-based, and players will need to complete mini-games and other tasks in order to progress. This makes it quite a linear experience, as the game offers no chance to backtrack once an area has been completed. With a deep story and varied locations, it's similar to other GameCube 3D platformers, like Star Wars: Bounty Hunter , in terms of aesthetic.

5 Donkey Konga 3

A Fun Rhythm Game

  • Release Date : 2005-03-17
  • Developer : Namco
  • Genre : Rhythm

Developed by Namco, Donkey Konga 3 was the final entry in this iconic rhythm-game series. Though both the original Donkey Konga and Donkey Konga 2 were released around the world, its third installment was only available in Japan. Donkey Konga 3 boasts even more tracks to play along to, and even lets players control the beloved Funky Kong, unlike in previous games. Players could make full use of the GameCube-exclusive accessory, the DK Bongos, to increase their enjoyment of the game.

Donkey Konga 3 has a greater music selection for jamming, all songs completely fresh and not reused from either preceding game. As well as well-known J-Pop songs, players could also play along to famous opening themes from anime series like Naruto , Dragon Ball Z, and Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo.

4 Asterix & Obelix XXL

Offers Plenty Of Action And Adventure Set In Ancient Europe

  • Release Date : 2004-06-18
  • Developer : Étranges Libellules
  • Genre : Action-Adventure

This game was only released on the GameCube in Europe, though it has since seen a worldwide release on more recent platforms. It may not have the best graphics for its era, but Asterix & Obelix XXL still offers a solid platforming adventure. Set in the year 50 BC, the duo meet a disgruntled secret agent from Rome, who agrees to help the duo on their quest to defeat the Romans.

Players control both titular characters, who play pretty similarly but have subtle unique traits. Obelix has greater physical strength, whereas Asterix is able to solve more puzzles. From rescuing villagers to battling the Roman armies, this adventure game has a bit of everything to make for some entertaining gameplay.

3 V Rally 3

An Addictive Racing Game

  • Release Date : 2002-06-21
  • Developer : Eden Studios
  • Genre : Racing

V Rally 3 was released only in Europe and Australia on the GameCube as a port of the original, but it never made it to America on this console. Incorporating real-life elements such as iconic cars and a realistic ranking system, this rally racing game has many traits that made it fun to pick up and play by players of any experience. Though critics felt the controls were too sensitive, they were also easy to learn for new gamers.

Another realistic element is its “Career Mode," as seen in other sports titles like the FIFA series. Players ‘become’ a rally racer who is offered contracts from various car companies and must complete their requirements to be hired as one of their racers. Players can rise through the ranks as they race on over 20 different tracks set around the globe.

2 Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale

A Unique Anime-Tie-In Offering A Range Of Gameplay Styles

  • Release Date : 2005-03-17
  • Developer : Hudson Soft
  • Genre : Action

Based on the manga and anime series, Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale is something of an RPG, fighting, and puzzle platformer all in one. The Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo series has had, as of writing, seven video games released only in Japan, this one alone for the GameCube. In Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale's Story mode, players traverse 5 different stages with Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo and his crew, engaging in an arena-style battle once they encounter enemies. Each character has their own unique Super Move.

The game also has a gallery and character bios among other extras, including the “Nose-Hair Training Center” in which four players can compete against each other. Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Dassutsu! Hajike Royale is as bizarre as the manga and anime itself. Unfortunately, the game does suffer from numerous glitches and pauses during battle, and characters' Super Moves suffer from long loading times — worse than in other games known for their loading times, such as Sonic '06 .

1 Kururin Squash!

Cozy, Colorful, And Calming

  • Release Date : 2004-10-14
  • Developer : Eighting
  • Genre : Puzzle

Kururin Squash! was only released in Japan, and it was a GameCube exclusive. Though it isn't well-known, this obstacle-course style game has fun, addictive gameplay. Despite the bright and colorful aesthetics and music, this doesn’t mean it is all that easy. Players are tasked with navigating a helicopter, the Helirin, through a maze without bumping into anything. Collecting coins is important too, as they can be used to buy new colors for the Helirin and download an extra game for the GBA, among other things.

There’s also different, even harder modes, making for hours of fun with this deceptively simple game. Although Kururin Squash remains extremely niche, the Helerin is featured as a trophy in the popular Wii title, Super Smash Bros Brawl. As such, Kururin Squash has loads of features that make it worthy of being one of the best GameCube titles, despite it having never been released in America.
